title: Charting Your Career Path and Book Next Steps

user_voice_extracts.content_preview: Good morning, ChatGPT. So today I would like to review some things on my mind. I'm feeling a little bit low today. I'm taking 15 milligrams of Adderall and my qualia from the Neurohacker Collective, just trying to stay positive and upbeat. And maybe it's the end of the year, maybe it's the fact that crypto is zipping and I never know when to sell, because I haven't figured out how to deal with taxes, and I don't really want to sell, and I don't really want to buy, I don't want to even look at it...
user_voice_extracts.full_content:
Good morning, ChatGPT. So today I would like to review some things on my mind. I'm feeling a little bit low today. I'm taking 15 milligrams of Adderall and my qualia from the Neurohacker Collective, just trying to stay positive and upbeat. And maybe it's the end of the year, maybe it's the fact that crypto is zipping and I never know when to sell, because I haven't figured out how to deal with taxes, and I don't really want to sell, and I don't really want to buy, I don't want to even look at it, and I don't really want to think about money, and I need to apply for a job, and I think I have a good prospect at the due school, but I don't want to ever get a job, because I'm not the kind of person that works for other people. I always have my own projects, and I work for myself, and it would be the first time, and I'd like you to sort of come up with 10 questions, work sort of like a mix between a coach and a psychoanalyst, and help me really reflect and think about my life, and the end of the year, it's December 23rd, 2024, and I'm feeling like the whole world is sort of falling apart, this war has kind of been going on, and I just feel a little bit uneasy in all sorts of ways, and I don't really have a job right now, or work, I have a little bit of money, but who even knows what money is, I don't know if I should be buying gold or silver, or what exactly, and I'm walking with my baby, and he's cute, and yesterday was my wife's birthday, and I'm trying to stay positive, but I'm having a hard time. Can you help me think through these things, and other things, you know, like I haven't really worked on my publication for my paper, and there's all these things that I just wish I was better at, but I'm not, and I'm getting old, and I don't really have time for working out, and my family's far away, and I don't know if I'm holding my application well, and my sheikh in Gambia, my teacher, spiritual master, has told me to always have a question of God, or a positive impression of God, and I'm struggling to do that. Can you tell me what to think, can you help me think through these things, go by questions, and try to help me understand, and find a better way forward?”
ChatGPT said:
ChatGPT
It's understandable that you're feeling overwhelmed, especially with so much on your mind. Let's take a step back and approach this one piece at a time. How about we start with a few reflective questions to help you gain clarity?

What specific aspects of your life are causing you the most stress right now?
When you think about your ideal work situation, what does it look like?
How can you incorporate small moments of joy or peace into your day?
What support systems or resources can you lean





You said:
“Yeah, Habibi? Yeah, so one, I think the most amount of stress is sort of like just feeling like I'm far from my family, that I don't really know about money and like what to do with my financial situation because the whole world seems topsy-turvy, and I guess I, you kn...[truncated]

Resists 'picking an audience' and making marketable books
Values depth and root causes over surface-level easy-to-digest content
Would rather work on 'deepest root causes rather than end results'
Major stress source: being far from family
Concerns about aging parents and preparing for their mortality
Values being present with baby and wife
Spiritual master (sheikh in Gambia) provides guidance
Muslim worldview influences business and resource philosophy
Talks about 'signs of God' in nature
Seeking work that has social impact and deeper purpose
Interested in technology for good, sustainable business
Conducted workshops on post-traumatic growth with Gaza/Palestine
Wants to help people 'find their contribution'
Wants to understand how diverse fields connect (epistemology, ontology, business, spirituality)
Sees himself as someone who needs to understand 'root causes'
Interested in 'how these things are all interconnected'

Bloom_pm.impact: Led to being irrelevant and quiet, hard to see

The_Awareness_Project.philosophy: See pain globally, act locally, not get overwhelmed

extreme_curiosity.pattern: Each topic becomes a lens on the whole worldview

perfectionism_and_overthinking.manifestation: Can't explain career simply, needs people to 'push into situations'
perfectionism_and_overthinking.self_awareness: Recognizes 'I just get in my own way'

authenticity_resistance.description: Strong aversion to 'packaging' ideas for marketability

authenticity_resistance.irony: This keeps him poor, confusing, and unhireable

periodic_depression.hereditary_component: sees it in grandfather and mother
periodic_depression.concern: Depends on exogenous sources for positivity
periodic_depression.age_awareness: Turning 40 next year, concerned about ADHD + aging trajectory

existential_concerns.future_awareness: Worried about parents aging, death, global collapse
existential_concerns.approach: Wants to prepare in advance for inevitables, not be 'surprised'

decision_making_framework.value_driven: Decisions guided by spiritual and philosophical values
decision_making_framework.resistant_to_external_pressure: Doesn't want to work for others, resist market pressures
decision_making_framework.reactive_rather_than_proactive: Gets pushed into workshops by others rather than self-initiating career moves
decision_making_framework.indecisive_on_money: Ambivalent about finances - doesn't want to track crypto, think about money, or pursue income-focused work
decision_making_framework.needs_accountability: Pays for courses/coaching because knows needs 'support, encouragement, backing, pushing'

self_perception.identity_confusion: Who am I? Renaissance man that nobody cares about? Or someone with potential to waste?
self_perception.comparison: Looks at Baraka Blue (Rumi), Ady Atiyah (Islamic economics), Benjamin Franklin (results) as reference points
self_perception.weakness_recognition: 'Just do way too many different diverse things that are not adding up'
self_perception.worldview_as_root_cause: Believes worldview limitations prevent career success - 'until my worldview changes, I'm not sure I'll be able to fix that'

communication_style.strength: Really good at talking, produces lots of text through audio
communication_style.weakness: Sitting down to write feels insurmountable, prefers oral storytelling
communication_style.depth: Rather work on deepest root causes than immediate practical stuff

money_and_resource_relationship.ambivalent: Doesn't really want money but knows has obligations
money_and_resource_relationship.philosophical_conflict: Money tied to self-worth (unhealthy) but necessary for family
money_and_resource_relationship.detachment: Would prefer money to come 'accidentally' from bank account, not connected to work
money_and_resource_relationship.worldview_constraint: Thinks his money avoidance is 'connected to my whole worldview'
money_and_resource_relationship.consequence: Impossible to have career when thinking/behaving this way
